info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 19 at 9:44PM CDT until August 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HENDERSON...NORTHERN WARREN AND SOUTHEASTERN MERCER COUNTIES... At 944 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Burgess, or 10 miles southeast of Aledo, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Burgess, Little York, Rozetta, Seaton, Lake Warren, Alexis, Bald Bluff, Gerlaw, Sunbeam, Eleanor and Big River State Forest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
